Windlord::

Windlord didn't know that the word "maximal" had helped. When he saw 
that Lokk wanted stay with him a while he asked to Lokk with a kind 
tone "Then, be welcome to Chivtron's base... "

He moved his hand to shake it with Lokk's

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> ::Axis/Lokk::
> 
> Lokk listened, and he word 'Maximal' triggered a thought, 
> <<Maximals... they must be relatively honourable bots... I think 
> that we should stay here for a while unless they prove other 
> wise...>> He turns to Axis and Seekker, "Hey, guys, what do ya 
> say we stay with these bots for a while, providing they lets us 
join?"
> 
> Axis, thinks, but not for very long, "Sounds good to me," Both wait 
> for Seekker.
> 
> 
> 
> On 25 Apr 2001, at 0:38, airly2000@y... wrote:
> 
> > OOC: add this to my last.
> > 
> > "I don't know if those reasons are enough, Lokk, to convice you 
that I'm not a menace" said Windlord "Our faction has to main 
objective survive; we're not allied with any faction here altough a 
friend and I helped Maximals once a while... I won't told you how 
many bot are in our faction, 'cause 
> until I don't have clear if you're an enemie or a foe, you won't 
get any information about my friends..."
> > 
> > Windlord knew that those words could do that Lokk started to 
attack him, but his loyalty to his friends didn't let him say more.
> > 
> >  
> >
